title: Quantum measurement (Born rule & state update) positioning

postulates.statement: Introduce ψ as a complex envelope of a bound mode of u=ln(P/P0) (operational; not claimed as first-principles).
Rest-phase + proper-time mapping yields the Schr/KG entry point with V=mφ in the weak-field nonrelativistic limit.
Born rule is adopted operationally: detection rate λ(x,t) ∝ |ψ(x,t)|².
Measurement update is treated as conditionalization on a macroscopic record (projective / POVM update).
Selection (acceptance) in Bell time-tag analysis is part of the measurement pipeline; treat as a systematics knob w_ab(λ).

projective.rho_m: ρ_m = Π_m ρ Π_m / Tr(Π_m ρ)

povm.p_m: p(m)=Tr(E_m ρ), with E_m=M_m^† M_m and ΣE_m=I
povm.rho_m: ρ_m = M_m ρ M_m^† / Tr(E_m ρ)

open_problems: First-principles derivation of Born rule from P-field dynamics
First-principles derivation of measurement update (irreversibility/pointer basis) from P-field + macroscopic apparatus
Identification of ψ with a unique P-field degree of freedom (phase, complex structure)
